data.description: Base class for HP RPN calculators.
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
I actually plan several vintage and current calulators. All use RPN
    notation. Perhaps RPN isn't important in the namespace:
    Tk::Calculator::HP. Or, perhaps, Tk::Calculator::HP::RPN. Do other
    manufacturers use RPN? This modules would implement methods common
    to all HP RPN calculators, such as stack manipulation, arithmetic
    functions, key bindings, etc.
